title: Junior Content Marketing Manager (m/f/d, full-time)
description: Do you love texting and digital communication? Us too! Klickkonzept is therefore looking for a Junior Content Marketing Manager (m/f/d) in Frankfurt. Apply now! New job despite the Corona crisisThe effects of the Corona pandemic can be clearly felt everywhere - many companies and industries are severely affected by the crisis. Nevertheless, Klickkonzept was able to flexibly adapt to the difficult conditions. For this reason, despite the current situation, we are looking for new, committed employees. Take the chance and apply now! At a glanceProfessional experience: Professional experience in copywriting, e.g. in an online editorial teamJob: full-timeLocation: Frankfurt am MainStart: immediately Are you interested? Apply now and send us your application.TasksWelcome to KlickkonzeptDo you love copywriting and can you easily empathize with any perspective? Do you have a passion for digital communication, online marketing and data-driven work? And you have a wide range of interests, enjoy working in a team and impress with personal responsibility and commitment? Then you should apply to Klick-konzept as soon as possible, because with us you will be responsible for a wide range of tasks in the area of ​​content marketing. As part of the international Labelium group with 300 employees worldwide, we offer you a unique environment for an international career at the highest level. This is what awaits you: You write web texts for different projects from very different industries, such as beauty, automotive, B2B or leisure providers. Types of text include: B. SEO texts for online shops, blog posts & guides, banners and text ads, landing pages or newsletters. You analyze customer websites from a content perspective and create comprehensive audits. After your training, you will be responsible for the content strategy and text creation of your projects and will work together with colleagues from other areas on strategy, implementation and success monitoring. You are involved in different areas of online marketing, such as SEO, SEA, email marketing, social media marketing and conversion rate optimization and work in interdisciplinary project teams. If you want that, you will be in direct contact with the customers. You are involved in international projects. The special thing about Klickkonzept: We are there for you! After intensive training and our onboarding week, you will learn new things day after day and week after week and be given more areas of responsibility. Our motto is: Learning by doing! Nevertheless, we give you responsibility for various projects right from the start. QualificationsIn order for you to join us as a Junior Marketing Manager, the following points should apply to you**You have experience in copywriting or in an online editorial team. You write error-free and stylistically confident. You are no stranger to storytelling. You can think of an interesting lead for every topic. You can think about completely different topics, industries and target groups and design your texts accordingly. You can identify with our click concept DNA and share our values. You are enthusiastic about digital media and new trends in this area. You think analytically and conceptually and love working with numbers. You can deal well with formal requirements. You work independently and responsibly and are a team player. Not a must, but helpful: You have a university degree or training in the field of marketing, media, communication or linguistics.** BenefitsWhat we offer youWe are an internationally active performance marketing agency with over 300 employees worldwide. For you this means: In our Frankfurt office you can expect a familiar atmosphere, harmonious coexistence, flat hierarchies and a working environment in which everyone feels comfortable and enjoys working productively and innovatively. At the same time, you benefit from the close cooperation with international colleagues all over the world. We want you to be able to develop and grow with the company. That's why we support your development, certify you in various areas and guarantee you exciting projects with a lot of self-determination. Thanks to our transparent career path, you can always find out where you currently stand and what opportunities you have. Regardless of whether you want to start working in other specialist areas or want to manage projects as a generalist, all options are open to you at Klickkonzept. A variety of employee benefits round off the overall package. Company pension scheme with increasing employer contribution. Regular team events such as shared breakfasts, after-work events and much more. We bond even more closely. Drinks, fruit and snacks of your choice at work. title: Technical Account Manager - German Speaking
description: Can you help us change the world?Yes, you read that correctly. It sounds grand, but we've got big ideas at Mews. We're transforming the world of hospitality, re-imagining the industry with a best-in-class cloud-based property management solution for hotels, hostels, apartments, and so much more.We're on the lookout for ambitious, tenacious and passionate people who want to join the next generation of innovators and disrupt the hospitality industry with us. Sound good so far? Keep reading and tumble down the Mews rabbit hole...  About the roleFirst things first: you want to know what you're actually applying for. It's impossible to capture every nuance of a role  especially at a rapidly growing company like Mews  but if we had to distil it down to a job description (which we do because this is a job description), it would be this:As a Technical Account Manager (TAM) you will prepare and deliver technical presentations explaining products or services to customers, communicate with cross-functional teams such as Product and Tech in order to understand customer's challenges with proper context, and provide guidance and support they need to be successful with Mews. This ranges from reactively enhancing utilisation of the various Products adopted by the customer, to proactively making recommendations to make use of additional features, modules, and products driving Customer Lifetime Value. As a TAM, you will be partnered with a Customer Success Manager (CSM) and have an assigned book of business to support together. Your mission, should you choose to accept it:Support customers, acting as the resource on product and technical knowledge, helping resolve customer's challengesProactively offer product insights and solutions to issues and implement either manual or automated solutions that best suit customer's needsCreate client-facing presentations with product demonstrations and proposed solutions for technical complaints or concernsKeep up-to-date with industry trends, and assist in researching and developing appropriate solutions with customersPartner with your CSM in building strong relationships with customers; participate in all customer-facing meetings such as CustomerSuccess Planning sessions, workshops and/or Business ReviewsUtilize every opportunity and experience to create a customer for life; own the escalation point for any technical issues impacting the customer's experienceLook for opportunities to offer additional services or functionalities to further enhance the customer's experienceLiaise with internal teams, including but not limited to Customer Success, Product, Product Marketing, Tech, and Sales You'll be a great fit if you bring a few of the below with yoProven experience as a Technical Account Manager or other relevant role within the Hospitality Tech spaceFluent in GermanUnderstanding of and experience working with API integrations, with the ability to read and understand these, specifically the communication between systems, and lines of codeDemonstrable ability to communicate, present and influence key stakeholders at all levels of the organization, including executive and C-levelSolid experience with hospitality softwareExperience delivering customer-facing solutions aligned with customer's goals and objectivesProven ability to juggle multiple account management projects at a time, while maintaining sharp attention to detailStrong empathy, organization, communication, and presentation skillsWhat's in it for you?Did you know that Mews has been voted theBest Place to Work in Hotel Tech for 2 years running? You do now. Most of that is down to our inspiring team, but part of it is because of some pretty amazing perks. As well as awesome colleagues and stimulating work, you'll get:Participation in the Company shares programBest-in-class Parental Leave Policy. At Mews, as the primary caregiver you get 6 months of fully paid parental leave, and as a secondary caregiver, you get 2 months of fully paid parental leave.(No matter your location, this can be used during the 1st year and applies if you've been employed for at least 1 year at Mews)Flexible Benefits via the ThanksBen platformUnlimited paid holiday (no, this is not a typo)Wellness Wednesday's (where every last Wednesday of the month, the whole company enjoys a paid day off to attend to your own well-being)Remote/flexible working (we're 100% hybrid-proof, but we cannot hire from anywhere in the world unfortunately, so feel free to reach out and check with us!)Monthly working from home allowance and a monthly healthcare insurance allowance (we want you to be happy & healthy)Regular team events and socials Who is Mews?We want to get to know you, so it's only fair we tell you a little bit about ourselves first.Mews has been transforming hospitality since 2012. What began in a single hotel in Prague now powers thousands of hotels around the world, as they pursue their mission to develop transformational solutions for brands and create remarkable experiences for guests.Since the beginning, Mews embraced being different. Mews is not simply a property management system, but a connected hospitality cloud with products across the hotel ecosystem and more integrations than anyone else.From global hospitality brands to independent properties, hoteliers join Mews because they recognize the power of innovation. They understand that they can benefit from hotel tech that drives efficiency, maximizes revenue, and improves guest happiness.Mews serves over 3,000 properties across more than 70 countries around the globe and works with a huge number of hotel tech partners to provide hoteliers with an unbeatable connectivity  no other solution offers as many integrations.At the 2020 HotelTechAwards, Mews was voted Best PMS by industry peers. Mews was also a Best PMS Finalist in 2021 and 2022, as well as being named Best Place to Work in Hotel Tech in the same years. Mews ranked 24th in the FT 1000 fastest growing European companies in 2021. Life at Mews That's what we do, but what about who we are? Mews' culture is special and difficult to capture in words, which makes writing this tricky. You'll experience the freedom to be yourself and the ability to watch your ideas come to life. You'll have an open line of communication and an open invitation to after-work drinks, be they virtual or in-person. Sometimes the work can be challenging and there can be a lot of it, but you'll always be able to rely on those around you.Yes, we're ambitious and we move fast, but we know the value of fun and taking a breather. Every month we have a Wellness Wednesday, a day off that you can use to boost your health, whether that's a long lie-in, a trip to the gym, or anything in between. We have slack channels for almost every interest imaginable, and an all-company meeting every Friday gives you the chance to ask any question to our leadership team.Oh, and we loveour pets . You'll be driving our growth machine, reaching out to businesses, meeting clients, pitching, negotiating and closing deals with businesses of all sizes.</text></gh-intro><gh-about-us><title>About us</title><text>Bolt is one of the fastest-growing tech companies in Europe and Africa, with over 100 million customers in 45+ countries. You can take advantage of a personal development budget and up to 3 days for learning activities. We win together, and we lose together: we have an international team of people from more than 25 different nationalities. We share one thing in common: we value regular peer-to-peer and management feedback. We believe in growth through dialogue and by asking the right questions: Management is happy to listen to you on open Monday all-hands or by a coffee chat. We balance speed and quality: we believe in agile and autonomous work, where priorities matter. We like to try new ideas and value A/B testing when developing our product and daily work. We believe in INTEGRITY: everyone is entitled to a healthy and balanced life, and we support it through additional health insurance, substitution for lunches, mobility, internet, and a discount for Urban Sports to support your regular physical activities.We enjoy flexibility at work and recognise the importance of team bonding: for this, we have chosen the hybrid work approach. Do you prefer to work from the beach? No problem! With our remote working policy, you can do it too.We are ONE TEAM: every newbie starts with a detailed onboarding. In your first days, you meet stakeholders and learn about our history, processes, product, strategy, and vision. We value collaboration and flat hierarchies: our management is always approachable for feedback and new ideas. We are committed, driven, and inspired: we value people who take ownership of their ideas and implement them. With us, you can see the real impact of your work! We are committed to growing: each quarter, we conduct an anonymous survey to see where we can improve as a company.Some extra perks: permanent contract, 28 days off + 1 more day off for every year you stay with us (capped by 3), and 24 and 31 December free. And you can have 2 additional vacation days if you keep active in the Humanoo app! We endeavour to provide a response within a period of 3-5 business days. This call serves as an opportunity for both parties to get acquainted.Hard skills Assessment: In the next step, you will have a theoretical discussion with an expert from our Finance team. This stage is designed to assess your hard skills proficiency and problem-solving skills in a real-time modeLead Interview with CEO: As a final step, you will have a one-on-one interview with our Chief Executive Officer (CeO). This conversation will provide an opportunity for you to connect with a key member of our leadership team.After the completion of these interview stages, our hiring team will convene for a debrief session to discuss your application. Following this debrief, our Talent Acquisition Partner will reach out to you to provide feedback and communicate the final decision regarding your candidacy. We value your interest in our organisation and appreciate your participation in our selection process.ABOUT USHUMANOO is an automated DIGITAL CORPORATE WELLNESS SOLUTION for corporations and insurances worldwide that helps people lead healthier lives. HUMANOO has offices in Berlin and Paris and helps users to improve physical and mental health by offering customised, on-demand programmes for fitness, yoga, mindfulness, sleep, and nutrition.HUMANOO's pioneering vision allows users to be rewarded for health activity through monetary and non-monetary rewards, leading to sustained engagement and study-based health improvement.More than 600 companies in over 10 countries are already successfully using Humanoo to make their employees and clients healthier and more productive.
